message.content:
cs.PL, cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.LO, cs.SY. 

The paper presents a technique for enforcing information flow policies in programs, which involves program synthesis and type inference. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) or Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the implementation of a DSL for data-centric applications, which suggests that it may also belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. The paper also involves the use of type systems and type inference, which suggests that it may belong to the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the enforcement of policies in a global context, which suggests that it may also belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
